title: Ownership structure of Bank of New York Mellon Corp stock

content.text:
Institutional investors hold a significant portion of Bank of New York Mellon Corp stock. Some of the major institutional shareholders include:

- Vanguard Group: Vanguard Group is the largest institutional shareholder of Bank of New York Mellon Corp, holding approximately 8.1% of the total shares outstanding.
- BlackRock: BlackRock is another prominent institutional investor, owning around 7.6% of the company's stock.
- State Street Corporation: State Street Corporation holds about 6.8% of the shares of Bank of New York Mellon Corp.

Insiders, including directors and executives of the company, also have a significant ownership stake in Bank of New York Mellon Corp. Insider ownership provides alignment between management and shareholders' interests.

In addition to institutional investors, there are several major shareholders in Bank of New York Mellon Corp, including:

- Vanguard Group: As mentioned earlier, Vanguard Group is not only the largest institutional investor but also one of the major shareholders, holding approximately 8.1% of the total shares.
- BlackRock: BlackRock also has a significant ownership stake in the company, owning around 7.6% of the stock.
- State Street Corporation: State Street Corporation, apart from being a major institutional investor, is also a major shareholder, holding about 6.8% of the shares.

These major shareholders indicate confidence in the company's prospects and may have a significant influence on its decision-making processes.
